result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Hoople was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to comply with any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Hoople

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:47 p.m. Defendant James E. Hoople in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Fraudulent Use of a Credit Card contrary to Wis Stat 943.41(5)(a)(1b).  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by the victim. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: 45 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: $100 Restitution, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal rights given.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

Case called @ 2:32 p.m. Defendant James E. Hoople in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting an adjourned plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi-potential resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD requests add'l time - negotiations continue.  STC adjourned - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:40 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant James E. Hoople in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves another copy of the Complaint - Receipt Admitted -  Def advised of right to counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD on eligibility.  Back of Record @ 2:19 pm:  Per SPD, Def will be eligible for services.  Any further reading of Complaint is waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing/time limits for preliminary hearing.   ADA argues for Signature Bond.  No objection by SPD.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Def has letter from victim which indicates contact requested.   State not requesting a no contact provision at this time.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
